author: Michael Larabel
description: Version 25.05 of the Open 3D Engine "O3DE" was released today for this open-source project born out of Amazon's Lumberyard engine nearly four years ago. With O3DE 25.05, this open-source game/simulation engine continues to be advanced by Amazon/AWS, Meta, Huawei, and other organizations...
title: Open 3D Engine 25.05 Brings Vulkan Improvements, Simulation Enhancements

author: Michael Larabel
description: The X.Org Server 21.1.17 and XWayland 24.1.7 point releases were issued today to fix the latest batch of security issues...
title: X.Org Server 21.1.17 & XWayland 24.1.7 Fix The Latest Batch Of Security Issues

author: Michael Larabel
description: AMD's Advancing AI 2025 event last week was very busy with announcing the Instinct MI350X and MI355X, the ROCm 7.0 preview, and debuting the AMD Developer Cloud. In addition, they held pre-briefs around the Ryzen Threadripper 9000 series and buried in as part of that was another new disclosure: Radeon Test Drive. Radeon Test Drive was brought up as something that's coming later this summer from AMD partnering with different hardware vendors to make it easier for developers/customers to try out ROCm on Radeon GPUs...
title: AMD & System76 Teaming Up For ROCm "Radeon Test Drive"

author: Michael Larabel
description: Prior to the AMD Advancing AI 2025 event last week, AMD shared additional details on their forthcoming Ryzen Threadripper 9000 series processors.
title: AMD Shares More Details On The Ryzen Threadripper 9000 Series

author: Michael Larabel
description: KDE Plasma 6.4 is out today with many fantastic improvements for this open-source desktop...
title: KDE Plasma 6.4 Desktop Released With Many Fantastic Improvements

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged recently for the Linux 6.16 kernel was initial support for Intel QAT Gen6 hardware. A new qat_6xxx driver was added for supporting the next-gen QuickAssist Technology accelerator IP being found with upcoming Intel Xeon processors. Patches being prepared now for the Linux 6.17 kernel are building out a new decompression service for that next-generation hardware...
title: Intel's Next-Gen QAT Hardware Can Be Optimized For Just Decompression Use

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged for Linux 6.14 at the beginning of the year were the Intel THC drivers for supporting the Touch Host Controller IP found in modern Intel Core Ultra laptops for dealing with the touchpad, touchscreen, and related touch-control functionality. This open-source driver is still being built-out ahead of next-generation Core Ultra laptops hitting the market...
title: Intel THC Linux Driver Ready To Support Wake-on-Touch "WoT"

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Dbus-Broker project from the BUS1/systemd developers is out with its first update in more than one year for this D-Bus implementation that aims to be more reliable and higher performing than D-Bus itself...
title: Dbus-Broker 37 Released For High Performance & Reliable D-Bus
